title: Understand the Problem
text: You need to substitute the values of $$x$$ and $$y$$ from the ordered pair into both equations. If both equations are true with these values, then the ordered pair is a solution to the system.

title: Check Each Equation
text: An ordered pair is a solution if it makes each equation true. Plug in $$x=5$$ and $$y=1$$ into each equation separately and see if both are satisfied.

title: Substitute in First Equation
text: Let's substitute $$x=5$$ and $$y=1$$ into the first equation: $$x+3y=8$$. What does the left side equal?

title: First Equation Validity
text: Does substituting $$x=5$$ and $$y=1$$ give us a true statement in the first equation? Use your result from the previous scaffold.

title: Substitute in Second Equation
text: Now, substitute $$x=5$$ and $$y=1$$ into the second equation: $$2x-9=y$$. What does the left side equal?

title: Second Equation Validity
text: Does substituting $$x=5$$ and $$y=1$$ give us a true statement in the second equation? Use your result from the previous scaffold.
